hints:
Use ARROW KEYS or
WASD to walk.
Press SPACE, Z or J to jump.

Press Ctrl, X, K
or  to attack.

Press Shift, C, L
or  to shoot.

Press DOWN to crouch and then
JUMP to high jump.

Hold down the ATTACK button
to CHARGE a power attack.

Hit bricks with your head
to break them.

Press DOWN + ATTACK after
jumping to do a down attack.

Hold down the SHOOT button
to CHARGE a power shot.

Hold JUMP BUTTON while
in the air to use jetpack.
Now you can walk on lava!

Press and hold JUMP BUTTON
after a jump to fly.

Now you can break blocks
with a scary face!

healthup:
It contains some sweet, sweet
vitality! It increases your
maximum health.
ammoup: You obtain a BOX OF BULLETS!

Now you can carry more bul-
lets. Somehow.
dreamorb:
It emits dreamlike energy. Who
knows what it does!
purchase:
Purchase this item?
It costs you %1.
shopdescription1:
Increases your maximum
bullet count by 2.

Slightly increases your
melee attack power.

Makes your bullets do
more damage.

Eating hearts will res-
tore more health.

You open the door with

locked_huge_door:
You need more dreams orbs to
open this door.
open_huge_door:
You open the huge door leading
to the Old Graveyard.
lick:
Lick the Eye? (I know
you want to!)
anvil_accept:
You put your OBSIDIAN CHUNK on
the anvil and start hammering.
lever1:
You pull the lever and some-
where a magical beam gets
deactivated, blocking your
way no longer.
lever2:
After pulling the level you
detect some unexpected fan
activity nearby.
cutscene0:
When the world was dying
they needed someone to
make them a new, better
world.

For this purpose they
created the Great
Dreamer

She dreamed a perfect
utopia, but one day she
started to question her
own creation.

They sealed her spirit
away so she could not
destroy what she had
created.

But now, the seal is
broken...
cutscene1:
They decided to call it
the "World of Dream".

It was reserved for
those who had wealth
and power.

It makes you wonder,
what happened to
the real world?

What happened to
the normal people?
cutscene2:
Lady Alexandra, that was
the name of the Great
Dreamer when she was
still a human.

She was chosen to be the
Great Dreamer because of
her outstanding ability
to dream worlds.

Or that is what
they claimed.
cutscene3:
When Lady Alexandra
was sealed away, the
Dream started to
decay.

People inhabiting the
Dream either vanished
or were turned into
monsters.

Without the Dreamer
there is no Dream...
cutscene4:
The Dream was created
because the real world
was dying.

But creating the Dream
only accelerated the
destruction.

It is, after all, a
world inside a world.
cutscene5:
Lady Alexandra has a
recurring nightmare,
where a giant eye is
chasing her.

They say the eye be-
longs to her father.

A man who sacrificed
her own daughter to
create a utopia for
rich and powerful.
cutscene6:
Lady Alexandra's father
was the leading engi-
neer of the 'Project
Dream'.

Rumors say that he knew
that the brain scan could
kill his daughter.

But he thought that the
sacrifice was worth it.
cutscene7:
Each time Lady Alexandra
had a bad dream, she
would dream a hero.

The hero would banish
the nightmare so that
the Dream could
continue.

But in the end, the
hero always dies...
cutscene8:
They did not simply
'seal away her spirit'
as they claimed.

Instead, they built
her a prison inside
her own mind.

For centuries she
was trapped inside
her own mind.

For centuries she
suffered unspeak-
able pain.
cutscene9:
Even though the Great
Dreamer was able to
break the seal, she
is not completely free.

However, she regained
her ability to commu-
nicate with her fol-
lowers.

Now she is waiting
for you inside her
collapsing prison.
npc0:
We are the keepers of
the Graveyard. Our
job is to bury dreams
that come here to die.

However, the Great
Dreamer told us to dig
you up and give you a
life. For what reason,
we do not know.

It has been centuries
since she talked to
us last time. You
must be very precious
to her.
npc1:
These portals connect
different parts of
the Dream together.
Some of them are
one-way only, though.
npc2:
Welcome, stranger, to
the World of Dream!
We don't get visitors
from the Graveyard
too often.

You must be the one the
Great Dreamer has
summoned. She must be
waiting for you...
somewhere.

Her whereabouts are not
known to us, I'm af-
raid.
npc3:
Did you know there is
also the Old Graveyard?
Nowadays we only bury
nightmares there.

Not all nightmares
remain dead, though.
Pray you never need
to go there.
npc4:
In the old times we hid
Dream Orbs around the
island. They were
stored in chests like
the one above us.

If you could gather
eight of them, you
won a special audience
with the Great Dreamer
herself.

This was when the old
citizens were still
alive...
npc5:
The Great Dreamer was
unable to dream proper
houses, so she gave
us these..."containers"
instead.

This one used to belong
to the woodcutter, but
then he vanished, like
all the other old
citizens.

Now this house is inha-
bitated by the shop-
keeper.
npc6:
This part of the Dream
is now long forgotten,
hence we call it the
'Forgotten Coast'.

There used to be a port
here. People could sail
to... hmm... somewhere?

I don't really know
what exists beyond
this island.
npc7:
There are many broken
portals in this island.
They used to connect
the Dream to the outer
worlds.

I think this particular
portal used to take
you to the Old
Dream.
npc8:
The Great Dreamer loves
puzzles, so she created
us islands full of
puzzles so we could
'train our brains'.

This is the only island
that hasn't sunken yet.
She is not very good
at making islands...

You can reset the
puzzle by leaving and
re-entering this place.
npc9:
There used to be many
people living down here
in these caves.

It is surprising how
many people prefer
mushrooms to sunlight!
npc10:
This passage used to
lead to the sewers,
but some time ago
it collapsed and water
rushed in.

I never understood why
we needed sewers: we
do not produce any
waste here, this is
a utopia!
npc11:
We are not people. We
are more like... Spi-
rits? Ghosts? Memories
of the past, perhaps.

That's why you can find
us standing in weird
places.
npc12:
This portal will take
you to the Old Grave-
yard.

To make sure that the
nightmares won't es-
cape that place we
sealed the door.

If you happen to find
eight Dream Orbs, you
can still open it, if
you wish.
npc13:
All those monsters out-
side used to be citi-
zens of the Dream.

Don't feel bad if you
have to kill them,
though: they can no
longer feel a thing.
npc14:
Long time ago Lady
Alexandra dreamed of a
nuclear war. It might
have been a nightmare.

Anyways, when it was
over we thought we
had better build a
shelter. Just in case.
npc15:
Ever wondered why we
need a graveyard in
a dream? In a place
that was supposed
to be a utopia?

I wish I knew. I guess
you cannot dream a
life without dream-
ing the death.
npc16:
Inside that beautiful
tomb you can find
The Eye, the greatest
nightmare ever lived.

If you go there, you
might get a sudden
urge to lick the Eye.
It might not be a good
idea, though.
npc17:
Ah, a visitor from the
old world! Welcome to
the 'New Dream'.

The Great Dreamer never
had a chance to finish
this part of the Dream,
unfortunately.

As you can see, she fi-
nally learned to dream
proper houses!
npc18:
Welcome to the Magic
Forge! Here you can
craft weapons of unbe-
lievable capabilities!

Well, only swords at
the moment. And you do
need obsidian, other
minerals won't work.
npc19:
This was supposed to
be Lady Alexandra's own
throne room where she
could be the Queen of
the Dream.

It is somewhat ironic
that the entrance to
her prison is located
in this very room.
item0:
It reminds you of your child-
hood. What a dummy you were!
item1:
It is a trusty (or was it rus-
ty?) old sword for all types
of unjustified violence.
item2:
It is one of those novelty
firearms where you put your
hand inside. Not very practi-
cal, but looks cool.
item3:
Its magical capabilities allow
you to breathe underwater,
making it possible to dive
without fear of dying.
item4:
You obtain a PAIR OF SPRING
BOOTS!

They are just ordinary leather
boots, but they have springs
in the bottom, allowing you
to perform a high jump!
Hooray!
item5:
This magical flames makes
possible to perform a power-
ful charge attack. Because
that's what magic fires do.
item6:
Knowing that this key only
opens red doors makes you
see red.
item7:
Not opening a blue door with
this key makes you feel blue.
item8:
It reminds you of the face of
your dying grandmother.
Better use it only to open
purple doors!
item9:
All this sudden negativity
gives you motivation to
learn a down attack.
item10:
You obtain a RECHARGABLE BAT-
TERY!

Now you can store some energy
plasma thing in your gun and
release it as a powerful
charge attack!
item11:
It lacks the booster addon,
so it is no good for flying,
but it can... uh, reduce your
landing speed, I guess?
item12:
You obtain a BOOSTER ADDON
(for your JETPACK)!

It makes your jetpack a proper
rocket pack, allowing you to
fly... at least for a short
while.
item13:
You obtain a NIGHTMARE BANISH-
ER!

It is the most powerful sword
ever created. It is so powerful
even your mother fears it.
item14:
It is a more powerful version
of your trusty hand cannon,
but that's not all: it can
shoot bullets that go through
walls!
item15:
Now you just need to find a
platinum door. Who would have
guessed!
item19:
They are a magical pair of
magical boots made of magical
crystals. With them, you can
walk on lava. Cool!
item20:
You could probably craft a
cool sword out of it. You
just need to find a forge...
inprogress:
This area is still work
in progress. Come back
after the next (major)
update!
